Package blackminer37.cannonballer

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.powerbot.script.AbstractScript<C>
      • org.powerbot.script.PollingScript<org.powerbot.script.rt4.ClientContext>
        • blackminer37.cannonballer.Main
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.EventListener, org.powerbot.script.PaintListener, org.powerbot.script.Script
    public class Main
extends org.powerbot.script.PollingScript<org.powerbot.script.rt4.ClientContext>
implements org.powerbot.script.PaintListener
    Version:
    1.0.0 This script uses PowBot to control an Old School Runescape character and automatically creates cannonballs for a profit as long as the character has the required materials and skill level.
    Author:
    BlackMiner37

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        This is first method to be called when the bot is started. This is where the set up method for the JFrame is called as well as where the timer and skill tracker are initialized
        Overrides:
        start in class org.powerbot.script.PollingScript<org.powerbot.script.rt4.ClientContext>

      • stop

        public void stop()
        This is where the bot is stopped and the JFrame is closed.
        Overrides:
        stop in class org.powerbot.script.PollingScript<org.powerbot.script.rt4.ClientContext>

      • logOutAndSuspend

        private void logOutAndSuspend()
        This is called when the bot needs to be logged out and suspended. This will not close the JFrame and it will keep the bot running in the background. By suspending the bot rather then stopping it the data that is being kept track of will still be there when the bot is resumed.

      • startSetUp

        private void startSetUp()
        This is called at start up. If the character does not have the required skill level then the script will end. If the inventory is not open, then this will open it. If the viewing angle isn't high enough then it will change it. This also decides which state the bot should start with by checking the inventory for steel bars

      • tick

        private void tick()
        This is called once every second. This is where the idle timer is being kept track of as well as where the actions left and time-to-level is switched back and forth to be displayed. If the bot is resumed from a suspended state this is where the bot is told to start running again.

      • updateMax

        private void updateMax()
        This is when the "Update Max" button is pressed. This waits until the bank is open and then it detects how many bars are left and adds it to the amount that has already been smithed.

      • poll

        public void poll()
        This is the heart of the bot. This is where the bot decides what to do based on it's current state. This is also where the bot detects and closes a "Press to continue" message like when a level is gained.
        Specified by:
        poll in class org.powerbot.script.PollingScript<org.powerbot.script.rt4.ClientContext>

      • bankGoods

        private void bankGoods()
        This is when the character is banking the cannonballs or other items in the inventory. At this time there should be no steel bars left in the inventory but lots of cannonballs.

      • travelTo

        private void travelTo()
        This is when the character is traveling to the furnace. At this time the inventory should have steel bars, the ammo mould, and no cannonballs.

      • smithCannonballs

        private void smithCannonballs()
        This is when the character is selecting the options to start smithing cannonballs. This goes through interacting with the furnace and selecting the option to smith cannonballs.

      • travelFrom

        private void travelFrom()
        This is when the character is traveling to the bank from the furnace. At this time the inventory should have no steel bars left, but there may or may not be any cannonballs.

      • waitForSmithing

        private void waitForSmithing()
        This is for when the bot is smithing and waiting to be done smithing. This is between when the smithing window closes and the character starts smithing and when there are no more steel bars left and the character is not doing anything. This is also where the amount of bars that have been smithed is being kept track of, and if the amount of smithed bars is equal to or above the max number then the bot will call the logOutAndSuspend method.

      • checkEnergy

        private void checkEnergy()
        This checks if the character has enough energy to start running if not running already.

      • map

        private int map​(int num,
                int nMin,
                int nMax,
                int min,
                int max)
        This puts a number (num) on a scale of min and max. Example: (num=6, nMin=0, nMax=10, min=0, max=100) This will return 60 as the number 6 is scaled up to be between 0 and 100; This also works the other way around: Example: (num=60, nMin=0, nMax=100, min=0, max=10) This will return 6 as the number 60 is scaled down to be between 0 and 10; As well as backwards: Example: (num=6, nMin=0, nMax=10, min=100, max=0) This will return 40 as the number 6 is scaled up to be between 0 and 100 and then the remainder is used; As well as with a complicated scale: Example: (num=6, nMin=2, nMax=7, min=12, max=43) This will return 37 (36.8 rounded up) as the number 6 scaled up to be between 12 and 43; ****** NOTE: This can easily be modified to return double values by changing all the Integers as well as the return type to double. ******
        Parameters:
        num - The number that is being scaled
        nMin - The minimum value that num could be
        nMax - The maximum value that num could be
        min - The minimum value that num can be scaled to
        max - The maximum value that num can be scaled to
        Returns:
        The num scaled to be between the min and max values

      • updateWindow

        private void updateWindow()
        This updates the information in the JFrame window.

      • repaint

        public void repaint​(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        This currently does nothing.
        Specified by:

      • initComponents

        private void initComponents()
        This initiates the JFrame window and it's components. The components are: nameLabel - JLabel(); smithedLabel - JLabel(); timeLabel - JLabel(); profitLabel - JLabel(); gpPerTextField - JTextField(); gpPerLabel - JLabel(); gpSellTextField - JTextField(); gpSellLabel - JLabel(); barsTextField - JTextField(); barsLabel - JLabel(); progressBar - JProgressBar(); prevLevelLabel - JLabel(); nextLevLabel - JLabel(); xpTillLabel - JLabel(); xpHrLabel - JLabel(); ttlLabel - JLabel(); updateButton - JButton(); separator - JSeparator(); runningLabel - JLabel();
